text: Susan P. Casteras is a professor of the history of art at the University of Washington.Susan Casteras. University of Washington School of Art. Retrieved 22 May 2015. Casteras received her undergraduate degree from Vassar College and her doctorate from Yale University.Speaker Bios: Susan Casteras. Smithsonian Institution. Retrieved 22 May 2015. Casteras was curator of paintings and sculpture, Yale Center for British Art, 1977-1996, and lecturer, History of Art Department, 1978 to 1996. Casteras is a specialist in Victorian art, particularly Pre-Raphaelitism. Casteras's The Grosvenor Gallery: A Palace of Art in Victorian England (1996) was the first detailed study of the Grosvenor Gallery.The Grosvenor Gallery A Palace of Art in Victorian England. Yale University Press. Retrieved 22 May 2015. ==Selected publications== *Images of Victorian Womanhood in English Art. Fairleigh Dickinson University Press, Rutherford, 1987. *English Pre-Raphaelitism and its Reception in America in the 19th Century. Fairleigh Dickinson University Press, Rutherford, 1990. *James Smetham: Artist, Author, Pre-Raphaelite Associate. Scolar Press, Aldershot, 1995. *The Grosvenor Gallery: A Palace of Art in Victorian England. Yale University Press, New Haven, 1996. (With Colleen Denney) == References == Category:Yale University alumni Category:University of Washington faculty Category:American art historians Category:Living people Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Vassar College alumni Category:Yale University faculty
title: Susan P. Casteras
